es.ull.iis.simulation.parallel
Class FlowDrivenActivity

java.lang.Object
  es.ull.iis.simulation.parallel.SimulationObject
      es.ull.iis.simulation.parallel.VariableStoreSimulationObject
          es.ull.iis.simulation.parallel.TimeStampedSimulationObject
              es.ull.iis.simulation.parallel.Activity
                  es.ull.iis.simulation.parallel.FlowDrivenActivity
All Implemented Interfaces:
Activity, Debuggable, Describable, FlowDrivenActivity, Identifiable, SimulationObject, VariableStore, VariableStoreSimulationObject, Prioritizable, java.lang.Comparable<SimulationObject>
public class FlowDrivenActivity
extends Activity
implements FlowDrivenActivity

An Activity that could be carried out by an Element and whose duration depends on the finalization of an internal Flow.

This activity can be considered a hybrid Activity - StructuredFlow, and its behaviour is similar to the latter.

In order to work in a 3-phase approach, the inner flow must be requested in a later time than the flow driven activity. Consequently, the Element.DelayedRequestFlowEvent event is used.

Author:
Iván Castilla Rodríguez

request

public void request(WorkItem wItem)
Description copied from class: Activity
Requests this activity. Checks if this activity is feasible by the specified work item. If the activity is feasible, Activity.carryOut(WorkItem) is invoked; in other case, the work item is added to this activity's queue.

Specified by:
request in class Activity
Parameters:
wItem - Work Item requesting this activity.
